subject: Design
title: The Crystal Palace: Prefab Design Goes Big
description: A quick, practical guide to The Crystal Palace: Prefab Design Goes Big.

hook.text: In 1851, London built a glass palace covering 19 acres â€” in just five months.

buildup.text: Joseph Paxton designed it using standardized iron frames and glass panels, like a giant kit.

discovery.text: It was the first major building assembled entirely from prefabricated, interchangeable parts.

twist.text: After the exhibition, the entire building was disassembled and rebuilt in a different location.

climax.text: The Crystal Palace proved that buildings could be designed as systems, not as monuments.

punchline.text: Modular design was born in glass and iron.

quiz.question: What made the Crystal Palace revolutionary in design?
